caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–6.
Tachycines ( Tachycines ) asynamorus Adelung, 1902
. 1. Hind tarsus, lateral view; 2. Male genitalia, dorsal view; 3. Male genitalia, ventral view; 4. Female subgenital plate, ventral view; 5. Ecological condition of male; 6, Ecological condition of female.(Figs. 5–6 from Shandong, Qingdao)

subSubSection.paragraph: Coloration. Body yellowish with distinct dark brown stripes. Face with 2–4 light yellowish longitudinal stripes. Legs with dark annular stripes.
Measurements. (length in mm) Body ♂ 11.0–13.0, ♀ 14.0–18.0; pronotum ♂ 4.5–6.0, ♀ 5.0–6.5; fore femora ♂ 8.0–10.0, ♀ 9.2–11.0; hind femora ♂ 15.0–20.0, ♀ 18.5–21.5; ovipositor ♀ 18.5–21.5.

Distribution. China ( Henan , Zhejiang , Jiangsu , Shanghai , Hunan , Sichuan , Shandong ); Korea ; Japan ; Europe; North America.
Diagnosis. This species is different from other species in this subgenus in that: hind metatarsus with bristles beneath and fore femora with spines beneath.
